sentences.sContent: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
...and it’s especially hard to reckon the likely costs of possible catastrophic climate events...
...Demographers reckon that three-quarters of humanity could be city-dwelling by 2050...

phrases.pCn: 处理；对付；和…算帐；预料到

remMethod.val: re(又) ＋ ck(一个著名时尚品牌) ＋ on → 看见CK没钱买， 指望工资快点来 → 指望， 盼望

words.tran: 计算手册；计算者；清算人

trans.tranCn: 认为， 估计； 指望， 盼望； 测算， 测量
trans.tranOther: spoken to think or suppose something
